Title: Manager, Talent Casting
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
We are looking for an experienced Casting Manager to oversee the recruitment and casting of Peloton Instructors who will represent our brand in various programs and experiences. This role involves identifying, auditioning, and managing talented fitness professionals who align with our brands vision, values, and goals. The ideal candidate will have experience in casting or recruiting fitness professionals, a strong understanding of fitness trends, and a passion for building a diverse and engaging team of instructors.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Lead and manage the casting process for fitness instructors, including sourcing, auditioning, and selecting talent for various fitness programs, classes, and events.
Lead casting and contract management for the creation of a Wellness board of Experts to serve as an advisory group, providing expertise guidance and recommendations to ensure the companys programs, services, and products are scientifically sound, safe, and effective. Their role would be multi-faceted, encompassing various responsibilities: program development and review, medical oversight, health education and content creation, research and Innovation, health assessments and personalized plans, collaboration with Instructors, and brand credibility. They would also be utilized externally with members.  
Collaborate with the stakeholders to understand the brands needs, audience preferences, and the type of talent required to represent the brand in fitness classes, events, and digital content.
Source and recruit top-tier fitness instructors through industry contacts, talent agencies, social media, etc.
Coordinate and schedule auditions and interviews for potential fitness instructors, ensuring a seamless process for both the talent and internal teams.
Assess the skills, personality, and on-camera presence of potential fitness instructors to ensure they align with the brands tone, values, and engagement standards
Maintain and manage a talent database, ensuring its up-to-date with detailed profiles of instructors, including their specializations, availability, and previous experience
Be an expert on fitness trends and competitor casting efforts, ensuring the brand stays ahead of industry trends and maintains a diverse and innovative team of instructors.
With that industry expertise, identify key events where our team should show up to show credibility and authority in the space, take to events team. Work with instructor team to curate their inputs into those events. 
Ensure diversity and inclusion in casting, actively seeking talent from diverse backgrounds to reflect the global and inclusive nature of the brands community.
Track and report on casting performance and talent engagement, ensuring the quality and effectiveness of instructor selection for ongoing projects.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

4+ years of related experience in talent casting, development and relations
Proven experience in casting or recruiting fitness professionals, instructors, or talent in the fitness industry.
Strong understanding of fitness trends, instructor engagement, and the fitness community.
Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
Ability to identify and recruit talent that aligns with brand vision, values, and audience expectations.
Strong organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines.
Experience with fitness certifications, training, and the various types of fitness programming offered across different platforms.
Ability to assess on-screen presence, personality, and engagement potential for fitness instructors.
Familiarity with casting software, databases, and other relevant tools.
Creative problem-solving skills and the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
Willingness to travel and work on evenings and weekends, as needed. 
Experience in Google Suite required.
Ability to work with high profile on-air talent in a discretionary, confidential environment.

Title: Sr. Financial Analyst
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton is looking for a motivated and results-oriented, Senior Analyst who will assist our FP&A team with Supply Chain finance across our Connected Fitness business. This person will work closely with our Operations and Supply Chain teams, ranging from manufacturing and inventory through procurement, to provide direct reporting and analytical support and will also partner closely with our Accounting teams. The ideal candidate is driven and resourceful, proactive with strong prioritization skills, has the desire to synthesize complex data to inform strategic business decisions. Flexibility is essential and the ideal candidate is able to adapt quickly in a dynamic environment. 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON


Partner with accounting all aspects of inventory accounting and COGS analysis, ensuring accurate inventory valuation, proper recording of transactions, and detailed analysis of COGS to support financial reporting and business decision-making


Maintain current view of inventory levels and ensure timely and accurate reporting of inventory reporting balances, comparing back to both prior year, budget, and current forecasts.


Regularly report on all Inventory and Cash related Supply Chain metrics to Pelotons Lead Team


Monitor and analyze inventory movements, including purchases, transfers, and adjustments, supporting all Cash Flow forecasting and actuals reporting.


Monitor and analyze cost trends, identify cost-saving opportunities, and provide recommendations


Collaborate with operations and procurement teams to understand cost drivers and implement cost control measures


Identify opportunities for process improvements in inventory management by working directly with both the Supply and Demand planning teams to ensure proper levels of inventory are maintained


Work closely with company-wide Procurement on cost savings initiatives, tracking actuals vs. budget to ensure projects are completed as planned


Collaborate with cross-functional teams to streamline processes and improve data integrity


Review and analyze financial information, prepare financial reports and accounting statements for Senior Leadership to accurately and timely make financial decisions


Develop internal processes to adhere to changing business requirements and evolving business regulations


Assume additional responsibilities and assist with projects as needed


YOU BRING TO PELOTON


Minimum 3 years of experience in FP&A / corporate finance / inventory accounting


Undergraduate degree in finance / economics / accounting / mathematics preferred 


Advanced Microsoft Excel / financial modeling skills and proficient in Google Suites (slides & sheets) 


Ability to draw insights from large data sets


Excellent communication and collaboration skills, particularly the ability to explain complex concepts to non-financial audiences 


A proactive self-starter with the ability to move workstreams forward independently and under tight deadlines while maintaining attention to detail 


High proficiency and enthusiasm for creating new reports to drive insight into business critical metrics 


Existing ERP knowledge, especially NetSuite and Oracle Hyperion Essbase, a plus

Title: Sr. Dubbing Coordinator
RoleDescription:
*This is a 12-Month, Full-Time Contract*
ABOUT THE ROLE
Join the Content team at a critical time as we push to realize our mission of Moving Millions Forward across the globe. This role offers the Business Momentum and Purpose in Motion of revolutionizing wellness by ensuring our content is localized for our international community, specifically through cutting-edge, AI-powered dubbing technologies. You'll drive the complex, end-to-end lifecycle of dubbing projects, balancing linguistic quality with technical innovation to deliver high-quality, culturally-relevant experiences that truly resonate with our Members.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Oversee and Advance the full dubbing lifecycle, partnering with our external localisation vendors to ensure the right-first-time delivery of high-quality content to our global Member community.
Manage Multiple Projects concurrently, proactively identifying risks and removing roadblocks to keep complex localisation initiatives moving forward with momentum.
Champion Workflow Optimization by implementing industry best practices and strategically leveraging AI-powered technologies to enhance scalability and cost-effectiveness.
Build and Empower a world-class network of dubbing talentincluding voice actors, directors, script adapters, and audio engineersto maintain the prestigious quality of our localized content.
Drive AI Improvement by organizing the evaluation of output from Voice AI technologies and providing detailed, actionable linguistic feedback to internal Engineering teams.
Create Collective Strength by developing, maintaining, and expanding essential language assets (glossaries, guides) and establishing cross-functional localisation best practices across the business.
Collaborate Seamlessly with internal teams (Programming, Production, Engineering) to align project execution and provide stakeholders with data-driven insights and recommendations on key dubbing metrics (quality, cost, turnaround time).

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

Proven Project Leadership managing end-to-end dubbing, localisation, or media production workflows in a fast-paced environment.
Bilingual Strength: Fluency in English is a must, coupled with native-level proficiency in another major European language to anchor your linguistic expertise.
Technical Agility using project management tools (like Asana or Jira) and possessing proficiency with dubbing-specific software.
A Solution-Driven Mindset that shows the courage and ambition to explore new ideas, develop innovative solutions, and prioritize efficiently when delivering to tight deadlines.
Exceptional Collaborative Skills and a credible, friendly personality that fosters trust and builds strong, cross-cultural relationships with both teammates and external partners.
Expertise in Language Asset Management, including the proven ability to own and maintain critical glossaries, style guides, and playbooks.
Nice to Have: Direct experience evaluating AI technologies or a genuine passion for fitness and content production.

WHY YOU'LL THRIVE HERE

You'll be at the forefront of the intersection between content and AI, driving innovation in how we deliver world-class wellness experiences to our millions-strong community.
We operate with a Bias for Action and a commitment to Career Agility, providing you with immediate ownership and the opportunity to stretch your skills by solving complex, ambiguous, and global business challenges.
You'll be part of a Collective Strengtha global Content team that works year-round to deliver high-engagement content, where diverse perspectives and clear focus on outcomes drive our shared success.

Title: Senior People Analytics Partner
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
At Peloton, we're not just revolutionizing how millions experience fitness and wellnesswe're building a world-class People team to support our incredible employees. As Senior People Analytics Partner, you'll be a driving force behind that mission.
In this highly visible individual contributor role, you'll be instrumental in evolving the people analytics function at Peloton, leading implementation and scaling of our new people analytics platform while collaborating with leaders across the business to deliver insights that inform critical talent decisions.
If you're a passionate analytics practitioner with technical expertise, exceptional rigor and a proven data storytelling ability,  this role is for you. This isn't just another jobit's an opportunity to help shape an iconic brand that genuinely transforms lives. Here, your success isn't measured by what you can accomplish alone, but by how many others you help achieve their best.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Platform Leadership: Serve as platform leader for our people analytics platform (Visier), driving implementation, adoption, and ongoing evolution to meet business needs.
Strategic Partnership: Act as trusted advisor to HRBPs, senior business leaders, and executives. Proactively identify opportunities where people data can inform critical decisions on talent acquisition, development, retention, organizational design, and DEI.
Advanced Analysis: Design and execute deep-dive analyses using advanced analytical techniques (statistical analysis, predictive modeling) to uncover insights, correlations, and forecast talent trends.
Reporting & Tooling: Build high-quality reports and dashboards using advanced analytical techniques (e.g., statistical analysis, predictive modeling) to uncover hidden insights and develop compelling, executive-level presentations that communicate complex findings to non-technical audiences.
Data Quality & Collaboration: Partner with engineering and systems teams to ensure data accuracy and establish a single source of truth. Support HR data source integration, maintain data governance standards, and define key business metrics for consistency across reporting.
Enablement & Communication: Champion platform adoption through training, documentation, and ongoing support. Foster self-service analytics culture and develop people analytics literacy across the organization.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

7+ years progressive experience in People Analytics, HR Technology, or related analytical role
Demonstrated expertise implementing/scaling enterprise People Analytics platforms
Direct experience with Visier platform implementation and administration
Proven ability to translate business problems into analytical frameworks and deliver actionable recommendations to senior leadership
Exceptional communication and executive presentation skills
Extensive experience advising business leaders on leveraging people data for strategic decisions
Strong proficiency in data visualization tools and advanced Excel.
Strong proficiency in HR data, metrics, and processes

PREFERRED

Advanced degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Statistics, or related quantitative field
Experience with statistical software (R, Python) for advanced analytics
Experience in fast-paced, high-growth, or global environments
Change management experience related to technology adoption and data literacy

ABOUT YOU
You are a strategic, impact-oriented professional who anticipates business needs and delivers measurable results through data. You excel at articulating complex ideas, building compelling narratives, and influencing decision-making at all levels. As a collaborative problem solver, you thrive on bringing structure to ambiguous challenges while maintaining rigorous standards for data quality and accuracy. You're curious, adaptable, and committed to continuous learning in an evolving field.

Title: Sr. Engineer, Continuous Improvement and Lean Manufacturing
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
The Senior Engineer, Operational Excellence & Lean Manufacturing will play a critical role in driving continuous improvement initiatives across Peloton's manufacturing operations. Based in Taichung, Taiwan, this role will focus on collaborating with third-party manufacturers to enhance operational efficiency, reduce waste, and implement lean manufacturing principles to achieve world-class manufacturing standards. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in operational excellence, lean manufacturing, and process improvement, coupled with excellent problem-solving skills and a passion for driving change.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Continuous Improvement:

Lead and facilitate continuous improvement projects using lean manufacturing and Six Sigma methodologies with third-party manufacturers.
Identify, analyze, and eliminate waste in manufacturing processes to improve efficiency and reduce costs.
Develop and implement standard operating procedures (SOPs) to ensure consistency and quality in production.

Lean Manufacturing:

Promote a culture of lean thinking and operational excellence throughout third-party manufacturing partners.
Conduct value stream mapping to identify areas of improvement and streamline production processes.
Implement lean tools and techniques such as 5S, Kaizen, Kanban, and Just-In-Time (JIT) manufacturing.

Operational Excellence KPIs:

Develop, track, and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) related to operational excellence, such as Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE), cycle time, lead time, first pass yield, scrap rate, and downtime.
Set targets and benchmarks for continuous improvement in collaboration with third-party manufacturers.
Utilize KPIs to monitor progress and drive data-driven decision-making to enhance manufacturing performance.

Data Analysis & Reporting:

Utilize data-driven approaches to identify trends, root causes, and opportunities for improvement.
Develop and maintain performance metrics to monitor the effectiveness of improvement initiatives.
Prepare and present reports on operational performance and improvement projects to senior management.

Training & Development:

Train and mentor team members and third-party manufacturers on lean manufacturing principles and continuous improvement methodologies.
Foster a culture of continuous learning and development within the manufacturing team.
Facilitate workshops and training sessions to promote operational excellence.

Collaboration & Leadership:

Work closely with cross-functional teams including production, quality, supply chain, and engineering to drive improvement initiatives.
Provide leadership and guidance to project teams to ensure successful implementation of improvement projects.
Act as a change agent to promote a culture of continuous improvement and operational excellence.


YOU BRING TO PELOTON

Bachelors degree in Engineering, Manufacturing, Operations Management, or a related field.
Minimum of 7 years of experience in operational excellence, lean manufacturing, or process improvement roles.
Certified Six Sigma Black Belt or Lean Manufacturing certification required.
Proven track record of leading and implementing continuous improvement projects in a manufacturing environment.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to use data to drive decision-making.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and third-party manufacturers.
Proficiency in using lean manufacturing tools and techniques.
Experience with ERP systems and manufacturing software is a plus.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with a focus on achieving results.
Fluent in Mandarin and English is required.

ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton is looking for a strategic and experienced leader to join our Legal team as Director of Product Safety. The role will be based in our NY HQ.
In this critical role, you will be responsible for setting Pelotons legal strategy for matters relating to the safety of our innovative hardware and software products. You will also act as a strategic partner to our Product, Engineering, and Safety & Compliance teams throughout the entire product lifecycle, from initial concept to post-market monitoring, and will be the primary Legal liaison for product safety matters within the company, including with senior management and the Board of Directors.
This role requires a leader who can operate at both a strategic and tactical level, providing sound, business-oriented judgment to navigate complex regulatory landscapes while championing the safety of our Members. You will be instrumental in overseeing and evolving our best-in-class consumer product safety program to enable innovation while protecting Peloton and its community.
The ideal candidate will have deep subject matter and regulatory expertise, with prior CPSC experience strongly preferred; sound business judgment; and the ability to provide practical, actionable advice in a fast-paced environment. You must also be able to quickly learn and thoroughly understand Pelotons multifaceted business, including its partners, Members, and products, to support the achievement of our business objectives while prioritizing Member safety.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Manage and evolve the global product safety legal function, taking ownership of all related legal and compliance matters, regularly reviewing and refining product safety policies and procedures, and establishing the long-term vision and strategy.
Serve as the key legal strategist and advisor to Pelotons C-suite on critical product safety issues, external-facing communications related to product safety, risk management, and regulatory engagement.
Act as a senior strategic partner to leaders in the Product, Engineering, Supply Chain, and Safety & Compliance functions, overseeing internal safety governance processes and driving the integration of safety-by-design legal principles across the entire product lifecycle.
Partner with business stakeholders to implement and scale sophisticated, world-class policies, procedures, and training programs to ensure global product safety compliance and readiness.
Direct the legal response to post-market safety escalations, providing decisive leadership on incident investigations, corrective action plans, and potential recalls.
Lead the companys engagement and strategy with global product safety regulators, including the CPSC and EU authorities. Partner with the Government Investigations team and other relevant cross-functional partners on responses to regulatory inquiries.
As a senior leader within the Legal department, collaborate with peers across Litigation and Government Investigations, IP, Privacy, and Commercial to ensure a cohesive and comprehensive legal strategy that supports Peloton's mission.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

A J.D. from an ABA-accredited law school and membership in good standing of at least one state bar (New York bar admission preferred).
12+ years of progressive legal experience, with a deep focus on consumer product safety, product liability, and regulatory compliance at a top-tier law firm, in-house at a global consumer products company, or a combination thereof.
Deep experience and familiarity with the CPSC, its regulations and its processes. Significant experience with international product safety regimes is highly desirable.
Extensive experience advising executives and boards of directors on high-stakes product safety and regulatory matters.
A proven track record of building or leading a product safety legal program, demonstrating the ability to set strategy, drive execution, and influence cross-functional teams.
Decisive leadership skills with exceptional business judgment and the ability to provide clear, pragmatic, and solutions-oriented advice under pressure.
Outstanding communication skills, with the ability to explain technical details. inspire confidence and build consensus with internal and external stakeholders.

Title: Hardware Product Manager, Tablets
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton is seeking a visionary and results-oriented Hardware Product Manager to own the strategy and execution of our tablet portfolio. The tablet is the heart of the Peloton experience, serving as the nexus that seamlessly integrates our custom hardware, award-winning content, and proprietary software. This is a high-impact, highly cross-functional role that requires a leader who can navigate technical complexity and drive alignment across the entire organization.
As the ideal candidate, you will have a deep understanding of consumer electronics and the ability to operate at the intersection of hardware, software, and content. You will be responsible for defining, developing, and launching the next generation of our tablets, making critical product decisions that balance user needs, technical feasibility, and business goals.

Own the Tablet Product Strategy: Define the long-term vision and roadmap for the Peloton tablet portfolio, ensuring it aligns with our broader business goals and anticipates future user needs.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

4-6 years of experience as a Product Manager in the consumer electronics space (e.g., tablets, PCs, smart displays, gaming consoles, or other hardware with deep software integration). Deep understanding of the hardware development process, including manufacturing, supply chain, and quality assurance.

A passion for fitness and an understanding of the connected fitness landscape is a plus.
Experience working with global teams is a plus

Title: Talent Producer
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
 
The Talent Producer is responsible for providing creative support and assistance to an assigned group of Peloton Instructors. This role involves working closely with Instructors to help shape and produce high-quality classes and content for Pelotons various platforms. The Talent Producer will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Programming, Music, and Social Media, to deliver content that aligns with Pelotons brand standards and resonates with the audience. Talent Producers typically support Instructors with a mix of experiences as on camera and multichannel talent. Talent Producers will on average support 3-5 Instructors that teach 1-4 fitness modalities. This role involves a focus on providing hands-on support in content creation, assisting with execution, and ensuring the overall vision of each class is met. While the Talent Producer will contribute to creative processes, this role is focused on production support, content development and delivery. It is an ideal position for someone looking to grow within Pelotons fast-paced environment, with opportunities for learning and development in creative production and talent management.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON
Content Development & Execution:

Pre-Production Support: Assist in providing support to assigned Instructors by preparing class plans, scripts, and creative briefs to ensure alignment with Pelotons standards and the Instructors voice.
Creative Assistance: Contribute ideas for class themes, social media content, and promotional materials. Help pitch and develop creative concepts for their talent for all channels as related to Peloton.
Research & Collaboration: Assist in conducting research for content development and work with the Music team to ensure the appropriate selection and integration of music into class plans.
Content Execution: Collaborate with the Studio Producer team during content execution, ensuring smooth production processes. Support the team with any edits or adjustments as needed, and ensure the content aligns with production guidelines.

Feedback & Instructor Support:

Class Support: Attend and/or review Instructors' live or recorded classes to offer constructive feedback, ensuring the final content aligns with Pelotons production standards.
Social Strategy Support: Help develop strategies for enhancing Instructors' social media presence and brand. Work closely with the Social Media team to ensure consistent messaging across platforms.
Class Clips & Social Content: Assist in identifying and capturing key moments from classes to be used on Pelotons social media channels, ensuring that the content is aligned with Pelotons overall brand messaging.

Programming & Cross-Functional Collaboration:

Programming Support: Work with the Programming team to ensure Instructors class schedules are well-balanced and that content diversity is maintained. Support programming strategies to optimize Instructor performance.
Content Development & Protocols: Assist in the creation of production protocols for new classes and content, ensuring adherence to Pelotons fitness standards in collaboration with Fitness Development and Training teams.

Creative Producer Lead:

As assigned, provide support for cross-functional concepts, collaborating with their team and team leaders to execute ideas from start to finish. This ranges from individual Instructor concepts to medium to large content initiatives.
Talent Producers will also be captains of fitness programming initiatives, driving creative support in partnership with Talent Producers & Instructors. Examples of fitness programming subjects are launching new class types, new fitness areas of interest

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

Experience: At least 24 years of experience in production, broadcast, or creative roles, preferably in a content creation environment. Experience working with on-camera talent is beneficial.
Education: Bachelors degree in Journalism, Communications, Media Production, or a related field, or equivalent professional experience.
Creative & Editorial Skills: Strong writing, research, and editorial skills. Ability to assist with creative ideas and help execute content development with attention to detail.
Fitness & Production Knowledge: While formal fitness qualifications are not required, a basic understanding of Pelotons fitness modalities and production protocols is helpful. A strong interest in fitness content is essential.
Technical & Social Media Savvy: Familiarity with social media platforms and content editing tools. Knowledge of how to create engaging, shareable content for various platforms is a plus.
Personal Qualities: Strong communication skills, attention to detail, and a collaborative mindset. Ability to work in a fast-paced, creative environment while remaining organized and proactive.

Work Environment & Requirements:

Based at either the New York, with a requirement to be in the office at least 3 days per week. Additional days or weekend work may be required based on team or business needs.
Must be willing to work flexible hours, including nights, weekends, and holidays, as needed to accommodate production schedules.

Title: Manager, Strategic Finance
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton is looking for a passionate and motivated Strategic Finance Manager to support the business with thoughtful financial analysis and to drive strategic decision-making. This role sits within Pelotons broader Financial, Planning and Analysis (FP&A) team and reports to the teams Senior Director, FP&A.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Through ad hoc, creative financial modeling, you will help senior leaders assess complex topics across various aspects of Pelotons business, including Corporate Development & Strategic Partnerships, Product Development, Content Production, Sales & Marketing, Operations and more. 
You will help senior management define the Companys strategic priorities by working closely with Pelotons Strategy & Business Operations team and leaders across the organization.
You will support Pelotons Long Range Planning efforts by incorporating our strategic goals to a multi-year financial plan, leveraging scenario analysis to identify risks and opportunities and to align our resources with long-term goals.
You will be the Finance business partner to the Strategic Partnerships and Corporate Development team, providing end-to-end support across the lifecycle of a deal and maintaining the teams P&L forecasting and reporting. This includes evaluating potential M&A and Strategic Partnership opportunities by performing financial due diligence and valuation analysis. 
You will collaborate with various cross-functional teams on an ad hoc basis to provide financial modeling and analysis support to answer complex business questions. 
You will support the evolution of Pelotons capital allocation strategy and execute capital markets transactions.
You may assist in preparation of Board of Directors and quarterly Investor Relations materials.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

You have 5+ years of experience across Strategic Finance, FP&A, Corporate Development, Private Equity and/or Investment Banking. Experience with M&A and Capital Markets transactions is preferred.
You demonstrate high proficiency and enthusiasm for complex problem-solving with financial modeling and analysis.
You possess strong communication and presentation skills, capable of concisely presenting complex analyses to senior leaders.
You are a proactive and a highly organized self-starter, able to work independently and under tight deadlines while maintaining attention to detail.
You have the ability to work collaboratively and cross-functionally in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment.
Education in Finance, Economics, Accounting, Mathematics, related field or relevant experience
You have industry experience in SaaS-based technology, media, and/or consumer products companies.

Title: Director, People Business Partner
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE 
The Director, People Business Partner (PBP) leads the delivery of all strategic HR services to internal client groups to drive outstanding performance and lead the overall Peloton talent agenda. Success in this role comes from fostering a strong focus on culture and well-being, becoming a credible partner to business leaders, embedding and role modeling DEI, providing expert insights, and embracing resiliency, agility, and scale. The ideal candidate will bring extensive experience, preferably within the Media, Entertainment, Retail, or Supply Chain industries.
The ideal candidate is a strategic HR partner who is passionate about delivering business impact. In collaboration with the senior leadership team, this role will focus on driving programs that ignite our talent, enrich our culture, and build leadership capability at all levels. Reporting to the Senior Director, PBP, this person will work closely with our  highly collaborative Centers of Excellence teams. This role is based in our NYC headquarters with team members working a hybrid schedule- three days (3) in the office and two days (2) remotely. 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON 

Provide thought leadership regarding organizational and people-related strategy and execution in a globally matrixed environment to drive a high-performance culture
Assess organizational performance systemically, defining talent gaps and proposing HR solutions that support client business objectives
Coach business leaders on HR processes, including talent planning, learning and development, and performance management to promote engagement and a culture of continuous growth and development
Provide guidance and input on workforce planning, succession planning, and retention activities
Analyze trends and metrics, and collaborate with HR functional experts to develop solutions, make recommendations, and develop programs
Partner with the centers of excellence (Compensation and Talent Management) on key programs throughout the annual talent cycle
Partner with the Employee Relations team, Employment Legal, and other key stakeholders on the identification, escalation, risk mitigation and resolution of employee relations issues
Strengthen senior leader capabilities through 1:1 coaching to help them refine their leadership capabilities/effectiveness
Infuse DEI practices into Pelotons culture, fostering an environment of inclusion and support aligned to Pelotons vision, mission, and values

YOU BRING TO PELOTON 

8+ years of HR business partner experience with strong expertise in talent management and DEI ability to work in a dynamic environment
Experience working with senior executives (C-suite, SVP/VP)
Recognized as a credible (garners respect, acts with integrity, keeps commitments); proactive (has a point of view, challenges assumptions, takes initiative); and a trusted thought partner (builds relationships, delivers results)
Highly collaborative work style; ability to establish relationships and partnerships at all levels of the organization 
Exhibit strong leadership and influencing skills, and design, implement, and lead change management initiatives 
Exhibit agility and adaptability during periods of transformation, leading teams through change with purpose, tact, poise, and patience
Critical thinking skills with the ability to take sizable problems and break them into small manageable pieces 
Superb judgment and integrity, including excellent decision-making skills
Ability to work both tactically and strategically to meet the needs of the business
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and metrics, using insights to make informed recommendations that drive strategic HR decisions
Experience working with a diverse international employee population and the ability to navigate global HR practices globally preferred
Industry experience in media and/or entertainment, with a proven track record of supporting executives and their departments preferred.
Partner with leaders to cultivate an engaged workforce, ensuring they own and actively contribute to the company culture
Demonstrated business acumen, with a deep understanding of how HR strategies align with and drive overall business objectives, enabling effective decision-making and impactful talent management

Title: Manager, Accounting
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
We are currently seeking an Accounting Manager to join and support our Accounting & Finance department. The ideal candidate for this role will possess exceptional business acumen and strong proficiency in using software tools like Excel to enhance process efficiency and effectiveness. A solid understanding of U.S. GAAP and internal controls is required, along with experience collaborating with both internal and external auditors. We are seeking an analytical and data-driven professional who can effectively support cross-functional work streams. Experience working within both SaaS and Retail business models is highly valued.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Facilitate and manage the month-end close process, ensuring adherence to timelines and providing assistance to staff as required.
Oversee part of the Accounts Payable process, verifying proper approval of invoices and travel and entertainment expenses, and resolving any outstanding billing issues.
Assume responsibility for the timely and accurate completion of monthly account reconciliations for critical areas, including payroll, marketing, capital expenditures, leases, bank accounts, and occupancy costs.
Maintain fixed asset schedules and ensure compliance with internal policies, capitalise assets from Construction in Progress (CIP) and  (FAAS), and record depreciation journal entries.
Prepare and be responsible for monthly payroll journal entries and all payroll-related balance sheet accounts for all entities.
Review and reconcile marketing expenses in collaboration with the marketing team to manage the monthly marketing spend analysis, including scrutiny of required month-end accruals.
Prepare and review rent and occupancy reconciliations, including information gathering for key lease data and validation of rent schedules under U.S. GAAP standard ASC 842 and IFRS 16.
Own the monthly analysis of financial statements and report on variances against plan and prior forecasts.
Prepare and review Studio Profit and Loss statements, including information gathering and monthly meetings.
Assist with financial and tax audits and any ad hoc filings.
Play an integral role in new system rollouts to the International markets.
Undertake other assigned projects, including participation in special projects, ERP and other system implementations, internal controls, and ad hoc analyses.
Manage and oversee third-party teams, including training, onboarding, and efficiency management

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

Bachelors or higher degree in Accounting or Finance
ACCA/CIMA qualified or equivalent 
In-depth knowledge of Accounting theory and application of U.S. GAAP
4-6 years post-qualification experience 
Big Four or similar-paced industry experience highly preferred
Experience with working in a complex ERP system
Experience in technology, retail and/or e-commerce preferred
Excellent communication skills; proven ability to communicate effectively with internal and external business partners at various levels in a clear and concise manner
Proactive self-starter who enjoys a fast-paced environment and an ability to prioritize, multi-task and meet pressing deadlines
Team player with a strong work ethic
Demonstrable people management experience

Title: Manager, SEC Reporting and Technical Accounting
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
We are looking for a highly motivated and detail-oriented Manager, SEC Reporting and Technical Accounting to join our Accounting and Finance team at Peloton! This person will be part of the SEC Reporting team, which owns our external reporting processes as well as supervising and managing the quarterly internal reporting to different executives and committees of the company. This position will report to the Director, SEC Reporting and Technical Accounting and is crucial in ensuring the accuracy and integrity of our financial statements.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

SEC Filings: Lead the preparation and timely filing of all external financial reports, including Forms 10-K, 10-Q, 8-K, and other required SEC filings. This involves drafting financial statements, footnotes, and MD&A sections. You will coordinate the review process with internal teams, external auditors, and legal counsel.
Earnings Materials: Assist in the preparation of materials for the Disclosure Committee, Audit Committee and senior leadership. Support the review and tie out all financial information within the quarterly Shareholders deliverables, investor materials, debt covenant calculations, statutory financial documents, and any other financial info in the earnings release documents to support the earnings call and additional needs of the Investor Relations team
Reporting and Disclosure Research: Support the research around our complex accounting issues for significant transactions to ensure all significant and unusual transactions are properly reported and disclosed in our filings.
Internal Controls and SOX: Maintain and enhance internal controls over financial reporting to ensure compliance with the SOX. Act as the primary point of contact for external auditors during quarterly reviews and the annual audit, helping to manage the audit process and fulfill information requests.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with various teams, including FP&A, Legal, Tax, and Investor Relations, to provide accounting guidance and ensure consistent financial reporting. 
Process Improvement: Identify and implement improvements to the financial reporting process to enhance efficiency, accuracy, and timeliness. This includes leveraging financial reporting software like Workiva or similar platforms.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

5+ years of progressive experience in financial reporting, external audit, and/or accounting at a public company.
Active CPA license required.
Deep and current knowledge of U.S. GAAP, SEC reporting requirements, and SOX compliance. Experience with financial reporting software (e.g., Workiva), NetSuite/ERPs, and automation tools is a significant plus.
Exceptional attention to detail, strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, and the capacity to manage multiple deadlines in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.
A passion for developing and sharing knowledge around critical reporting areas to the business.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to distill complex accounting and reporting concepts for a non-technical audience.
Absolute discretion and confidentiality regarding sensitive information

ABOUT THE ROLE
The Sr. FATP Supplier Quality Engineer will be working with the Peloton Quality and broader Operations teams to drive improvements and support in the management of quality processes and quality management systems at our manufacturing partners facilities. This will be done by evaluating that they are following best practices for inspection, providing root cause and corrective action guidance and by integrating with their teams to help identify and execute data driven process enhancements and improvements. Quality Systems: Maintain and improve company quality management systems (QMS) in compliance with applicable regulatory & Peloton requirements related to control of processes and product.
Management: Responsible for representing overseas quality team onsite, training, and ongoing support of staff. Required to effectively communicate project goals to Suppliers. Provide technical guidance and training (mentorship) to suppliers to their ongoing development to reach company goals. manage supplier audit program and suggest new suppliers to audit.

Steer and support the design control aspects of product quality, program management, and quality planning from product design through manufacturing. Assess, support and process supplier approvals and re-approvals in the approved supplier list (ASL).

Monitor, support and resolve production related quality issues with materialsuppliers.
Auditing: Responsible for overall audit program execution. Developing, implementing, and auditing risk-based annual quality control audit plans and schedules. Conduct and lead supplier, internal and external GMP(Good Manufacturing Practice) and ISO compliance audits. supports production line qualification initiatives, continuous improvement, and regulatory compliance across all supplier sites. Reports results and recommendations for changes as required. Confirms acceptable follow up action on audits. Monitors performance to audit schedules, execution, reporting and audit finding closureswithin established audit plans and timelines.

Training: Coordinates and/or provides training to staff in GMP/ISO, Quality Systems, Supplier Quality, and Safety awareness. Provides ongoing development and maintenance of training materials and records.
Compliance: Ensures compliance with company quality policies and practices by participating in product and material reviews, assist in troubleshooting problems related to the manufacture, testing, validation and documentation. May be responsible for aspects of MRB, corrective actions, process control, complaints, document control, calibration & preventive maintenance programs and product/process/equipment validation activities.
Work with Peloton Quality Control team to develop and implement inspection and escalation plans
Coordinate disposition and cost recovery for non-conforming material from suppliers
Drive supplier root cause analysis and corrective actions (8D) and validate results ensuring proper closed-loop corrective action process
Report weekly on defect rate and quality issues
Participate in Continuous Improvement activities to drive improved part design, cost reduction, and yield improvement
Drive JDM/CM accountability and facilitate communication with Peloton Management
Track and provide updates on Quality issues
Manage monthly Quality review meetings with JDM/CM.

5+ years of experience working as a supplier quality engineer in a similar fast-paced industry
Education in Engineering/Manufacturing
Demonstrated experience in robust supplier quality and applied knowledge with ISO9001, IATF16949, APQP, SPC, MSA, FMEA, QOS, PPAP, 8D
Robust understanding of 2D drawings and GD&T
Experience with CAD tools (Solidworks knowledge is a plus)
Capable to perform Gage R&R, capability studies

Title: Senior Product Designer, Central Design

RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
At Peloton, the Learning and Development team empowers individuals to thrive by creating learning experiences that foster growth, longevity, and professional joy, enabling everyone to perform their best. 
We are seeking a highly organized and tech-savvy Learning Technology and Operations Specialist to join our dynamic Learning & Development team. This role is the backbone of our learning ecosystem, ensuring smooth program execution and a seamless learning experience. Reporting to the Director of Learning and Development, the ideal candidate combines technical systems administration skills with hands-on coordination process.
You will manage our Learning Management System (LMS) daily and provide critical operational support for training initiatives, from preparation and logistics to co-facilitation and community engagement. If you are ready to enhance our team members' learning experiences, apply now!
 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON 
Learning Management System (LMS) Administration (50%)

Serve as the primary administrator and technical point of contact for the company's Learning Management System, Seismic.
Manage all aspects of the LMS, including course creation, user enrollment, audience management, and permissions.
Upload, test, and deploy various learning content, including SCORM-compliant eLearning, videos, documents, and assessments.
Generate and analyze data to create insightful reports and dashboards on learning activity, course completion rates, and program effectiveness.
Provide timely and friendly technical support to end-users, troubleshooting and resolving LMS-related issues.
Manage system updates, conduct regular maintenance, and collaborate with the LMS vendor to resolve complex issues and explore new features.
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of all learning data within the system.

Learning Operations & Coordination (50%)

Coordinate all logistics for virtual and in-person training sessions, including scheduling, calendar invitations, room/virtual meeting setup, and roster management.
Prepare, organize, and distribute digital and physical training materials (e.g., workbooks, slide decks, pre-work assignments).
Act as a producer or co-facilitator for virtual instructor-led training sessions. Responsibilities include managing breakout rooms, launching polls, monitoring chat, and assisting participants with technical challenges.
Support learning exercises and activities during training sessions to drive engagement and reinforce learning objectives.
Serve as a key point of contact for employees and managers with questions about learning programs, schedules, and enrollment.
Administer post-training surveys and compile feedback to help the L&D team measure program impact and identify areas for improvement.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON:

2-3+ years of experience in a Learning & Development, HR Operations, or similar role.
Direct hands-on experience administering a Learning Management System, ideally with Seismic. Must be comfortable with technology and able to learn new systems quickly.
Exceptional attention to detail and ability to manage multiple projects and tasks under tight deadlines.
Experience running learning reports, utilizing dashboards, and analyzing data.
Familiarity with content authoring tools (e.g., Articulate 360, Vyond).
Basic understanding of instructional design principles and adult learning theory.
Proven experience as a producer or co-facilitator for virtual training.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with a customer-centric mindset.
Proficiency with Google Suite (Slides, Docs, Sheets) and Zoom.

ABOUT THE ROLE
We are seeking an experienced Senior Manager, Member Support Operations to join our globally diverse and talented team working from our Peloton Plano Headquarters. This is a critical leadership role within our Global Member Support organization, ideal for someone who thrives in a high-volume, fast paced environment and is passionate about delivering a best in class Member experience.  
In this role, you will oversee the day-to-day execution and delivery of frontline service operations, ensuring operational rigor, performance consistency, and a culture of excellence across your team.  Youll be accountable for driving key performance metrics, optimizing workflows, and partnering cross-functionally to solve complex business challenges while ensuring every Member interaction reflects Pelotons high standards.  
This role supports a team of hourly team members and people leaders.  It requires a dynamic and data-driven leader with experience leading at scale in a contact center environment. This role will additionally partner with our business partners (BPOs) to ensure a consistent approach and sharing of knowledge across the network.   
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Operational Leadership: Provide tactical direction and oversight to the contact center team to ensure consistent service delivery aligned with Pelotons goals.
Executive Escalation Management: Lead the strategy, execution, and resolution of high-visibility, executive-level escalations, ensuring swift, accurate, and empathetic responses that protect Pelotons brand reputation.
BPO Partnership & Alignment: Build deep, trust-based partnerships with our BPO network, maintaining a strong understanding of their operations to drive consistency, performance alignment, and shared accountability across all sites.
Performance Management: Drive accountability through data-driven coaching and a results-based performance culture.
Process Optimization: Identify and implement improvements that enhance contact center efficiency, reduce friction, and improve first contact resolution.
Team Development: Lead, coach, and mentor a team of managers and supervisors, fostering continuous development and engagement.
Workforce Planning: Partner with Workforce and Real Time Analyst teams to ensure proper staffing, scheduling, and service level adherence.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Align with key internal teams (Product, Logistics, Engineering, Legal, Security, etc.) to resolve escalations and improve support processes.
Member Advocacy: Champion the Member voice, using insights to remove barriers and improve the end-to-end experience.
Recruitment & Culture: Support hiring, onboarding, and retention efforts while contributing to a positive, inclusive, and high-performing call center culture.
Strategic Execution: Translate business priorities into operational plans with a bias for action and measurable outcomes.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

Contact Center Expertise: 5+ years of leadership experience in a contact center or customer support environment, preferably in a medium-to-large, multi-site, or BPO supported environment.

Continuous Improvement: Passion for process improvement, innovation, and delivering exceptional service experiences.
Resilience and Flexibility: Adaptable in a rapidly evolving environment with competing priorities and complex workflows.

Title: Sr. Director, Communications, Product and Technology
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLEPeloton is seeking a strategic and highly connected Senior Director of Product Communications to lead the external communications strategy for our growing portfolio of consumer hardware and digital technology products. Reporting directly to the Chief Communications Officer, this individual will serve as the companys communications lead for all product-related announcements, innovation narratives, and milestone moments. This is a high-visibility leadership role that will shape how Peloton's groundbreaking products are perceived in the market - both by consumers and industry influencers.
You will oversee integrated product communications across software, hardware, and digital platforms. You will work closely with executive leadership, including product, design, engineering, marketing, and talent brand to create and execute world-class go-to-market communications strategies. A critical component of this role will be cultivating relationships with top-tier consumer and technology press, think The Verge, WIRED, Fast Company, and TechCrunch, and securing marquee moments and speaking opportunities that place Pelotons innovations and leaders at the forefront of the industry.You are an exceptional storyteller, experienced in bringing complex technology products to life for broad consumer audiences. You are just as comfortable briefing a top-tier tech journalist as you are preparing a C-level executive for a global product launch. You bring a track record of successfully leading communications for major launches and driving coverage that shapes public perception.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Develop and lead global product communications strategy for Pelotons connected fitness, software, and digital product innovations.
Serve as a trusted strategic advisor to executive leadership, particularly across product and engineering, helping shape and articulate the companys innovation story.
Own the media strategy and execution for all product announcements, launches, and innovation milestones - securing impactful coverage that positions Peloton as a category leader.
Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with top-tier media, influencers, and analysts across consumer tech, innovation, and lifestyle verticals.
Identify and secure high-impact speaking opportunities and industry stages (e.g., CES, SXSW, Wired25) for Peloton executives and technical leaders.
Oversee development of all product comms materials including press releases, talking points, media pitches, blog content, and executive bylines.
Lead agency and vendor partnerships to scale campaign execution, story amplification, and product storytelling.
Collaborate cross-functionally with internal communications, product marketing, investor relations, legal, and brand teams to ensure consistency and alignment across all public messaging.
Monitor industry trends and competitive activity, providing insights and recommendations to leadership.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

10+ years of experience in communications, with significant experience leading product and technology PR in-house or at top-tier agencies; experience launching high-profile consumer tech or hardware products is required.
Strong relationships with leading tech and business media, with a portfolio of impactful placements in outlets like The Verge, WIRED, Fast Company, TechCrunch, Bloomberg, and others.
Proven experience crafting and leading complex, multi-channel launch strategies for consumer technology products.
Exceptional leadership and interpersonal skills, with experience managing high-performing teams and working cross-functionally with senior leaders.
Demonstrated ability to manage complex situations, and deliver results in a fast-paced environment.
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills; writing samples required.
Experience working with or within a product or engineering organization is a strong plus.
Bachelor's degree in Communications, Journalism, Marketing, or a related field; advanced degree a plus.

Title: Sr. Tooling Engineer
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
The Senior Tooling Engineer is a crucial position for optimizing the tooling development from tooling design to production sustaining with JDMs (Joint Development Manufacturer), ODMs (Original Design Manufacturer) and CMs (Contract Manufacturers) with consideration in both throughput and quality, while also advice on optimizing part & assembly design for manufacturing (DFM) with internal design and engineering team. An ideal candidate should have hands-on experiences with hydroforming tooling, metallic tooling and process design and/or tool trial trouble shooting on site. Experienced with injection toolings, overmolding techniques, rubber forming, progressive dies, stage dies, transfer dies, tool steel selection, deep draw, high speed stamping, forging, surface coating, surface finish processing and heat treating are important traits of an ideal candidate as well.
To ensure the quality delivery of the program, the Senior Tooling Engineer is responsible for several key tasks. These include drafting supplier-facing tooling requirements and maintenance plans, which will be based on both product demand and design specifications. The engineer will also gather tooling information to populate company asset databases. Furthermore, the role involves active participation in tool trial activities and conducting supplier capability studies to guarantee tool quality. To support the company's long-term growth, the Tooling Engineer will be responsible for developing a knowledge library for advanced materials and fabrication, contributing tooling input for product design requirements, and building simulation models for tooling and part cost analysis.
The Senior Tooling Engineer will not only provide day-to-day technical support for internal teams and JDMs/ODMs/CMs, including engineering changes implementation on tooling, part availability tracking and schedule discussion and cost reduction but also continuous improvement in both quality and time, hands-on implementation of the improvements in the production lines for ensuring manufacturing activities. 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Collaborate with cross-functional engineering teams to ensure robust DFM/DFA, providing expertise in material & process selection, tooling design and material requirement, process audit and tooling qualification plan
Lead and direct the tooling team, ensuring all tooling across JDMs, ODMs, and CMs consistently meets or exceeds performance, quality, and efficiency goals. This includes design review, approval, maintenance, calibration, and end-of-life considerations for optimized manufacturing.
Engage in detailed technical discussions about part fabrication, manufacturing processes, material selection, and potential challenges. Determine appropriate manufacturing processes to achieve desired cosmetic and functional requirements, considering tolerances, surface finishes, and production
Validate tooling designs, including continuous discussions with suppliers/tool makers and CAE simulations for troubleshooting.
Work with ODMs and CMs to provide engineering support in problem solving and root cause analysis that are tooling related, then understand and help refining technical requirements for products and processes for future and on-going productions
Manages and establishes tooling maintenance standards at vendor sites. Conducts tooling audits to ensure quality of maintenance.
Conduct on-site supplier audits to analyze factory capacity and capability. Collaborate with suppliers on equipment recommendations, conduct financial payback analyses, and submit Capital Expenditure requests to management.
Voice of Peloton manufacturing on cross-functional teams for aligning engineering requirements with manufacturing feasibility
Proposes and identifies innovative applications for existing Peloton materials, products, and processes.
Identify cost reduction opportunities for continuous improvement initiatives involving daily operations, engineering, and processing

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

Bachelors degree or equivalent to demonstrate understanding of Engineering principles is required. Mechanical or mold and die tooling is preferred.
8+ years of engineering and tooling experience in a hands-on manufacturing environment is required (NPI to volume MFG MP stage)
5+ years of leadership experience is preferred
Excellent understanding of moldflow analysis application (injection molding and die casting preferred)
Good communication skills for ensuring engineering requirements are properly met at JDM/ODM/CM
Assuring tooling outcomes fulfilling program management requirements for supporting timely product launch purposes
Expertise in process development and quality control of highly cosmetic components highly regarded.
Valued expertise in cosmetic component process development and quality control, proficient in fabrication processes including sheet metal (hydroforming, stamping), CNC machining, complex assembly, welding, surface finishing, and post-processes (heat treating, plating, anodizing, milling, polishing, grinding).
Profound experiences in resolving tooling issues for assuring mass production
Good interpretation on engineering drawings, tolerances, GD&T
Software applications, CAD (SolidWorks preferred)/CAE
Flexibility to travel domestically and internationally 30% or more as needed

Title: Sales Manager, Consumer
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
We are seeking a dynamic and results-oriented sales leader to drive performance across our Sales channels, and Sales Operations functions in Germany. This role will be responsible for leading and developing the sales team, 3P partnerships, optimising sales processes and systems, and delivering strong sales results through data-driven planning, robust cross-functional collaboration, and best-in-class execution.
You will be central to our go-to-market strategy in Germany, developing Joint Business Plans (JBPs) with key partners, supporting commercial negotiations, ensuring operational excellence across all sales channels, and driving efficiency through effective sales operations. The ideal candidate will thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment and possess a strong track record in strategic sales leadership, partner management, and implementing impactful sales operations initiatives. 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON
Sales Leadership & Performance

Own sales performance across all sales channels, ensuring alignment with business objectives and targets.
Analyze sales performance data and trends across all channels to identify opportunities, address performance gaps, drive growth and continuous improvement.
Lead and manage the local sales team, providing clear direction, coaching, and accountability to deliver results.
Analyze sales trends to ensure strong performance and close performance gaps.
Develop and execute data-driven sales strategies to unlock growth opportunities and drive sales performance.
Collaborate with FP&A to build robust sales forecasts and track performance against budget.
Identify and analyze sales trends to inform strategic decisions and optimize channel performance.

Partner & Account Management

Own and deepen relationships with key 3P retail partner(s), acting as the primary commercial point of contact (day to day management).
Set up and execute long term account plans with 3P partner(s) to drive performance in line with both parties strategies.
Develop and execute a Joint Business Plan JBP to align on strategic pillars and key initiatives.
Organise and drive regular partner engagement (e.g., QBRs, MBR, performance reviews).
Support contract negotiation and renewal process to agree terms that unlock mutual value.
Establish multi-functional relationships with partners to become a preferred partner.
Understand each partners P&L and unit economics, and support initiatives that drive mutual profitability.
Drive strategic engagement with new potential partners, including partners assessment and deal recommendations to senior leadership.
Deliver best in class account management to drive mutual goals.

Sales Operations

Lead the Sales Operations function for Germany/Austria, focusing on optimising sales processes, implementing and managing sales technologies and ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
Develop and implement sales operations strategies and initiatives to improve sales efficiency, productivity, and effectiveness across all channels.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to streamline sales processes, resolve operational challenges, and ensure smooth execution of sales initiatives.
Develop and implement sales enablement programs and resources to equip the sales teams and partners with the knowledge, tools, and training needed to succeed.
Champion the adoption of best practices in sales operations and identify opportunities for continuous improvement.

Cross-Functional Collaboration & Execution

Work across functions (e.g., Marketing, FP&A, Operations, Supply Chain) to ensure alignment on channel initiatives and smooth execution of 1P/3P projects.
Support the business in improving overall unit economics and customer acquisition cost across sales channels.
Provide timely, insightful sales reporting for key internal forums (WBR, MBR, QBR) and ad hoc needs.
Champion process improvements and operational excellence across the sales organization.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

Demonstrable experience in commercial or sales roles, ideally within consumer, retail, or tech environments.
Proven experience managing retail accounts and/or direct-to-consumer sales channels.
Strong understanding of partner/channel dynamics and unit economics.
Confident leading cross-functional initiatives with stakeholders across Finance, Marketing, Operations, and Legal.
Excellent analytical and reporting skills; experience with sales reporting tools (e.g. Salesforce, Excel).
Strong communicator with executive presence; able to influence internal and external stakeholders.
Self-starter with high accountability and a bias for action.
Fluent German and English required.

Title: Program Manager, Sales Operations
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton seeks an organized, analytical, and creative-thinking Sales Operations Program Manager to support our DE/AT team. Reporting to the Sales Manager, the Program Manager will be required to deeply understand the businesses they support and execute initiatives that enable growth and overcome any barriers to operational excellence in addition to executing the day to day management of sales operations. They will partner cross-functionally with the entire Global Sales Solutions team and with teams across Sales, Supply Chain, Member Support, Finance, Enterprise Tech, and more and will regularly communicate program updates and implications to these global stakeholders.  They will also be required to build and maintain relationships with external partners and vendors and ensure they uphold their contractual obligations and our standards of excellence. 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Sales Operations: Execute the day-to-day management of Peloton sales operations in Germany/Austria, including but not limited to partner onboarding, activation support & management, external vendor management (agencies) & compliance, asset deployment, and budget management. 
Retail Activation: Identifies and recommends retail activation opportunities. Project manages and leads physical retail activations. Manages and directs the sales components of marketing and partnership activations, ensuring they align with overall business objectives.
Process Optimization: Identifying and implementing strategies to streamline processes, reduce inefficiencies, and improve overall operational efficiency. Develop and implement Sales Policies and Procedure (SOPs, documentation) when required.
Strong Business Acumen:  Ongoing review of business reports and participation in regular business reviews with international sales leadership to build a deep understanding of the business and identify opportunities to improve sales operational excellence. Act as a point person for operational questions, issues, and ideation.
Program Management: Collaborate cross-functionally to lead new sales programs or process rollouts and execute sales operations requirements. Assess program risks & provide options for mitigation. Utilize project management tools to remain organized and communicate program updates to stakeholders regularly.
Fleet Health Management: Partner with our Service & Repair team and 3rd party auditing partners to ensure our inventory in the field is in excellent working condition and complies with our brand standards.
Inventory & Customer Order Management: Partner with our Supply Chain leadership to develop operational standards for managing purchase orders, shipping, and logistics. Make sure that customers' orders are placed on time, reflected in the systems (internal and external), and delivered according to business requirements.
Data Analysis & Performance: Analyze operational data to identify trends, track performance, and generate reports, on a monthly and quarterly basis to inform decision-making.
Relationship Management: Effectively communicate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders, both internally and externally, ultimately building strong relationships and fostering collaboration.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

4+ years of relevant operational work experience in a B2C and/or B2B sales environment, preferably supporting  global teams.
Bachelor's degree and relevant sales experience preferred.
Self-motivated and driven individual who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.
Ability to work well with stakeholders and small, agile teams.
Experience developing & managing budgets.
Highly organized and thorough work ethic.
Understanding of Pelotons company vision and brand image with the ability to communicate it effectively and with enthusiasm.
Excellent written and editing skills.
Software proficiency in relevant sales software including but not limited to: CRM platforms, such as Salesforce, customer success platforms, Looker, and project management tools.
Ability to travel as needed.
Fluent German and English required.

Title: Localisation Project Manager
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Pelotons Content Department, comprising our Production, Studio Operations and Instructor teams, works 365 days a year to deliver a broad offering of highly-engaging subscription content to our members. We are a highly collaborative, fast-moving department that focuses on evolving our innovative programming. 
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Localisation Project Manager to support our localisation efforts, ensuring the highest quality and cultural relevance of our content for international markets. This role will be pivotal in shaping our localisation strategy, optimising AI-first workflows, managing vendor relationships, and critically, evaluating the performance of AI models specifically used for subtitling. The ideal candidate will possess a strong blend of linguistic expertise, project management skills, and a keen understanding of AI's application in the localisation landscape.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Oversee the end-to-end localisation lifecycle, liaise with Pelotons localisation partners, and ensure the timely and right-first-time delivery of high-quality localised content to Members. 
Manage multiple localisation projects concurrently, prioritising tasks and mitigating risks.
Implement and optimise localisation workflows, leveraging industry best practices and technology.
Recruit, train and manage high-performing freelance Linguists to support QC efforts.
Organise the evaluation of translation output from Machine Translation and other AI technologies, and provide feedback to Engineering teams.
Create, maintain and expand language assets, including glossaries, guides and playbooks, and contribute to the establishment of cross-functional localisation best practices.
Develop and maintain strong relationships with internal stakeholders, providing expertise and support, and communicating clearly on day-to-day operational activities.
Monitor the Member Support channels and resolve any captioning or localisation issues.
Monitor the relevant localisation performance data boards and report on the health status of captioning and localisation operations.
Liaise with our translation technology partners, suggest new features, resolve issues, and ensure smooth operation of the service.
Select, onboard, and manage external localisation vendors (LSPs, freelance linguists) to ensure consistent quality and performance.
Design and implement robust evaluation methodologies for AI-generated subtitles, assessing accuracy, fluency, cultural appropriateness, and readability.
Work closely with AI/Machine Learning teams to provide detailed linguistic feedback and identify areas for model improvement.
Analyse performance metrics (e.g., BLEU, TER, COMET, human evaluation scores) to gauge the effectiveness of AI models in subtitling workflows.
Conduct A/B testing and comparative analyses of different AI models or AI-human hybrid approaches for subtitling.
Stay abreast of the latest advancements in AI for natural language processing and subtitling, recommending new tools and approaches.
Track and report on key localisation metrics, including quality, cost, and turnaround time.
Provide insights and recommendations to stakeholders for continuous improvement and strategic decision-making.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

Expert knowledge of localisation processes.
Experience as a Localisation Project Manager or Producer.
Fluent English; native speaker of another major European language.
Experience with evaluating language AI technologies (MT, AI), or post-editing AI-generated translations.
Ambition and the courage to explore new ideas in order to develop innovative solutions and work efficiently.
Strong coordination skills, with the ability to handle pressure and be efficient when delivering to tight deadlines.
Proven experience in ownership and maintenance of language assets.
Friendly and credible personality who inspires trust in partners and colleagues.
Flexibility and a positive can-do approach that builds team spirit.
Ability to work independently and unsupervised on projects and report findings to management.
Demonstrated ability to set priorities and meet deadlines.
Experience working in agile and fast-paced environments.
Focus on detail and the end-user experience.
Proactive attitude and a sense of urgency.
Solution-driven thinking.
Must be able to work collaboratively and across cultures. 
Exceptional organisational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while adapting to changing priorities.
Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills.
Good vendor management skills.
Experience with (AI-) dubbing workflows is advantageous 
Interest in fitness and content production is advantageous
